snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo nominated Justice Sheila Abdus-Salaam to the New York Court of Appeals. If confirmed she would become its first African-American woman.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo nominates Justice Sheila Abdus-Salaam to fill vacancy on New York State Supreme Court left by death of Judge Theodore T Jones Jr; if confirmed, Abdus-Salaam would become first African-American woman to serve on court.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo nominated Justice Sheila Abdus-Salaam to the New York Court of Appeals. If confirmed she would become its first African-American woman.

headline.seo: Cuomo Nominates Justice Abdus-Salaam for Court of Appeals
headline.main: Cuomo Picks Judge in City to Fill Spot at Top Court
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Picks Judge in City To Fill Spot At Top Court
